translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules
1. The training rule on the open air

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū chamāyaṁ nisīditvā āsane nisinnassa dhammaṁ desenti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū chamāyam nisīditvā āsane nisinnassa dhammaṃ desenti pe
translated: at that time the monks from the group of six were teaching Dhamma to someone sitting on a seat while they were sitting on the ground. …

original: “Na chamāyaṁ nisīditvā āsane nisinnassa agilānassa dhammaṁ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: na chamāyam nisīditvā āsane nisinnassa a gilānassa dhammam desessāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not teach Dhamma to anyone sitting on a seat while I’m sitting on the ground,’ this is how you should train.”

original: Na chamāyaṁ nisīditvā āsane nisinnassa agilānassa dhammo desetabbo.
analyzed: na chamāyam nisīditvā āsane nisinnassa a gilānassa dhammaḥ desetabbo
translated: One should not teach Dhamma to anyone sitting on a seat while one is sitting on the ground.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca chamāyaṁ nisīditvā āsane nisinnassa agilānassa dhammaṁ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca chamāyam nisīditvā āsane nisinnassa a gilānassa dhammaṃ deseti āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, teaches Dhamma to someone sitting on a seat while he is sitting on the ground, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if he does not do it out of disrespect;
if he is the first offender.🔽The eighth training rule is finished.
